comments:
In 7/14 I build, every time a new JSP file is created, a NPE occurs causing poor
User message, and then occurs everytime typing occurs, in console. 

We've partially investigated fix, and should be easy null checks, but need to 
investigate further (since only happens for JSPs, and the code we see the
problem in would indicate should also occur for HTML and XML).

Stats: the cause of this problem remains ellusive, but we have found that it is
not so easy to reproduce as I thought. Some others on team occasionally get it
to occur, but I myself could not reproduce, once I had shutdown and reopened the
workbench. 

We'll continue to investigate, but given that it is not easy to reproduce, is
not so serious as to block the product release. 

If anyone else notices, please make a note here, so we'll know if it is a
frequent irregular bug, or a rare irregular bug.

I can reproduce the bug everytime I turn off/untick the
[Preferences->General->Editors->Structured Text Editors->Report problems as you
type]. Even I restarted the workbench. But at the time when your JSP file is
already opened with the JSP Editor it will follow the [Report problems as you
type] setting at the time of opening. Meaning even I have changed the setting
from untick to tick and tick to untick and click on the [apply] button, the new
setting did not apply to the JSP Editors that already opened, it only apply to
the JSP Editors after workbench restarted and also apply to all the JSP Editors
that opened after the [Report problems as you type] setting changes (on/off).

Below is the scenario :
When I untick/turn off : Preferences->General->Editors->Structured Text
Editors->Report problems as you type

Error dialog entitled [Processing Dirty Regions] keep on popping up at the time
I open a JSP file with JSP Editor, at the time I type a single character in the
JSP Editor and when I restarted the workbench with the cursor focused on the JSP
Editor.

I went to the [Error Log->Event Details] :
- An internal error occurred during: "Processing Dirty Regions".
java.lang.NullPointerException
at
org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui.internal.reconcile.StructuredRegionProcessor.filterTotalScopeRegions(StructuredRegionProcessor.java:168)
at
org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui.internal.reconcile.StructuredRegionProcessor.process(StructuredRegionProcessor.java:123)
at
org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui.internal.reconcile.DirtyRegionProcessor.run(DirtyRegionProcessor.java:412)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

Thanks! That makes it obvious enough. I was not getting with the preference set,
but since from same methods, probably similar in effect, just due to timing of
not being completely initialized. I'm guess. That also makes the fix easy ...
just checking for a null "stategy" before using it. 

Fix released approx. 1:30 7/18 for RC2 builds.
*** Bug 104168 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
updating title to reflect dup and new findings.
*** Bug 103660 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

we can avoid this error(Processing Dirty Regions) by opening the file in XML 
Editor(JBoss IDE)

the same xml/xsd file. Both installations are current (updated to the most
recent versions a few days ago).

This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP defects already verified by the reporter but awaiting closure by the assignee.  If you feel this defect was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

Thanks, John Lanuti
